Package test

Class Brick

Object
Brick
Direct Known Subclasses:
CementBrick, ClayBrick, GraphiteBrick, SteelBrick, VibraniumBrick
public abstract class Brick extends Object
An abstract class which will then be inherited by the specific brick types such as Clay and Cement. It consists of some general attributes which a brick must have while some attributes like the cracking of the brick isn't a necessity. Since there aren't much universal operations in terms of shared common functions among Steel, Clay, Cement, and etc, there will be no need to separate it into MVC (Model-View-Controller) design pattern so as to keep the code clean.
Author:
KhooChenNan

    class 
    Brick.Crack
    Crack class which is only implemented by bricks that crack such as Cement and Graphite.

  • Constructor Details

    • Brick

      public Brick​(String name, Point pos, Dimension size, Color border, Color inner, int strength)
      The constructor of for the class "Brick.Java". Initializes the random value, the initial value of "broken" variable to false to construct it. It also sets the name, visual, border color, inner color, and full strength of the brick.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the brick.
      pos - The coordinates of the brick.
      size - The size of the brick.
      border - The border color of the brick.
      inner - The inner color of the brick.
      strength - The strength of the brick.

  • Method Details

    • makeBrickFace

      protected abstract Shape makeBrickFace​(Point pos, Dimension size)
      An abstract method as mentioned prior to this which will then be implemented later on by other brick type classes.
      Parameters:
      pos - The coordinates of the brick.
      size - The size of the brick.
      Returns:
      The visual of the brick is returned.

    • setImpact

      public boolean setImpact​(Point2D point, int dir)
      Sets the impact of the brick by taking in 2 input parameters, its point and direction.
      Parameters:
      point - The coordinates of the brick.
      dir - The direction of the impact.
      Returns:
      If the brick is broken, it will return false. Else, it calls the impact() function and then returns the variable "broken".

    • getBrick

      public abstract Shape getBrick()
      A method that gets the brick.
      Returns:
      A brick in Shape data type is returned.

    • getBorderColor

      public Color getBorderColor()
      Getter method for the border color of that specific brick.
      Returns:
      The border color of that specific brick is returned.

    • getInnerColor

      public Color getInnerColor()
      Getter method for the inner color of that specific brick.
      Returns:
      The inner color of that specific brick is returned.

    • findImpact

      public final int findImpact​(Ball b)
      A function which determines the direction of reflection for the ball. E.g. If the ball is from right, the variable "out" will then be set to a specific value which tells the program to reflect it to that direction.
      Parameters:
      b - The ball which comes into contact.
      Returns:
      Integer data type "out" which determines the impact's direction.

    • isBroken

      public final boolean isBroken()
      Getter method for the variable "broken" due to its "private" access specifier.
      Returns:
      A boolean data type which tells the program whether it is broken or not is returned. "true" if broken, "false" if not.

    • repair

      public void repair()
      Repairs the brick to their respective full strength. E.g. If a brick has 1 life count left, calling this function will immediately increase its life count back to their highest possible life count.

    • impact

      public void impact()
      When the ball comes into contact with the brick, this function causes the strength of the brick to be reduced by 1 unless they are specially made like Steel.
